topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Overview

section.p: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade is a carrier grade OpenStack solution that enables CSPs to deploy applications on open source software platforms. HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade is based on OpenStack Kilo.

Some key aspects include Linux host operating systems, server virtualization (KVM), network virtualization (vSwitch and SDN controllers), an installer and cloud lifecycle management framework, fault and performance management, and high-availability framework for the OpenStack control plane.

HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade is based on HPE Helion Openstack 1.1 but with significantly enhanced and optimized functionality, availability, scale and performance to meet the needs of NFV cloud deployments.
Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade includes following key components:

ul.li: OpenStack—core services including Horizon, Nova, Neutron, Cinder, Glance, Swift, Keystone, Ceilometer, and Heat.

Compute node software package that includes:
Carrier-grade Linux (host operating system [OS] running on the compute nodes)
Carrier-grade KVM (for virtualization of the compute node)
Carrier-grade accelerated virtual switch (AVS), data plane development kit (DPDK)-enabled high-performance virtual switch
Management and middleware—composed of high-availability (HA) management; operations, administration, and maintenance (OAM); software image management; and fault and performance management
Guest software development kit (SDK) for inclusion in the guest OS of the VNF for performance acceleration and improving the HA framework above and beyond standard VIMs
HPE Helion Lifecycle Manager (HLM)—cloud installer and lifecycle manager
Near-line rate networking throughout for VNFs like vEPC, vBRAS, vIMS, vFW, vRouter etc.
Advanced resource scheduling and orchestration capabilities
NIC Bonding at the server level
Compute Node failure detection and Auto-evacuation in kvm region

section.title: Service Overview
section.p: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade is comprised of a number of services, including several OpenStack and HPE Helion OpenStack services.
For more information, see Services Overview.

body.section:
Installation OptionsHPE Helion OpenStack Carreir Grade has two baremetal installation options depending on your system configuration. It allows you to manage the KVM and VMware ESX hypervisors and provision virtual machines.
You can find more information on the hypervisor options in the Technical Overview.

section.title: KVM Topology
section.p: If you install the KVM deployment, you can integrate either HPE Storevirtual (VSA) or HP StoreServ (3PAR) storage in the KVM region.

ul.li:
With HPE StoreVirtual VSA storage
HPE StoreVirtual VSA software is a Virtual Storage Appliance that provides the complete array functionality on top of a Linux KVM environment without external hardware. VSA eliminates the need for external shared storage required to implement Block Storage features.

With HPE StoreServ (3PAR) storage
HPE 3PAR StoreServ is a storage array that supports Fibre Channel (FC) as well as iSCSI protocol.

section.p: You must install 3PAR or VSA before starting the HPE Helion OpenStack installation and are independent of HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.

section.title: Unbonded or Bonded NIC configuration
section.p: The HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation allows for network interface card bonding (bonded NIC).
